thread.title: Tom Brady suspects game-worn jersey was stolen
thread.title_full: Tom Brady suspects game-worn jersey was stolen

author: SETH WALDER
title: Tom Brady suspects game-worn jersey was stolen
text:
Apparently Tom Brady still hadn't tracked the jersey down by the time he left the stadium. (Matthew Emmons/USA Today Sports)  29 AM 
Tom Brady stole Super Bowl LI from the Falcons...and then someone stole his jersey from him. 
The Patriots quarterback said the jersey he wore during the game was taken at some point after the victory. 
"It was right here. I know exactly where I put it," Brady said, via USA Today Sports. That report also noted that backup QB Jimmy Garoppolo was instructing others players to look around for the missing jersey. 
"This is not good," Brady added. "It was right here and now I don't have it. Not good." 
Dan Hanzus of NFL.com captured Brady informing Patriots owner Robert Kraft about the theft in on video. Robert Kraft handing out victory cigars, including a special visit to TB12. pic.twitter.com/4GVyJdbrfw â€” Dan Hanzus (@DanHanzus) February 6, 2017 
"Somebody stole my game jersey," Brady says to the owner in the video. 
"Well we gotta look online," Kraft responds 
Apparently Brady still hadn't tracked the jersey down by the time he left the stadium. As the five-time Super Bowl champion quarterback walked to the team bus he confirmed to ESPN that he believed it had been stolen, saying, "Yeah. It will be on eBay soon, I guess." Tags:
